item.title: Top 5 Learnings After 2 Years of Being a Founder
item.description: I shut down my first company in Oct’21. We were building first, unprepared, listening to folks who weren’t our ideal customers and investors. The core things learned retrospectively: Sell first, build later: Focus on building accurate user personas first. And talking to sufficient users before building anything. Be Patient: Things take time to pan out. Once you actually zero down on the building, it could take 6-12 months to see the impact and meaningful adoption.

item.title: Side Hustling Since 8 Years

item.title: Books
item.description: Books most impactful in my early-stage Tech founder journey Getting the right Founder Mindset Startup CEO : A Field Guide to Scaling your Busines The otherside of Innovation : Solving the Execution Challenge (Harvard Business Review) What Customers Want : Using Outcome-Driven Innovation The Mom's Test : How to Talk to Customers Who Not How : The Formula to Achieve Bigger Goals Through Accelerating Teamwork Networking & Sales It's Not All About Me : The Top Ten Techniques for Building Quick Rapport with Anyone To Sell is Human : The Surprising Truth About Movin Others Challenger Sale : Taking Control of the Customer Conversation Productivity Predictably Irrational - Dan Ariely Eat that frog : 21 Great Ways to Stop Procrastinating Innovation to Create Breakthrough Products and Services Deep Work : Rules of Focused Success in a Distracted World Venture Deals Other Resources: Product Management Resourced by product folks Blog's On FirstRound HackerNews
